name: mlm_supp
tagline: Supplemental Material for Graphical Methods for Multivariate Linear Models in Psychological Research
body:
### Supplemental Material for Graphical Methods for Multivariate Linear Models in Psychological Research

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/master/DataEllipse.png)

This page is intended to serve as an accompaniment to a paper prepared by Dr. Michael Friendly (@friendly) and Matthew Sigal (@mattsigal). The article pertains to a tutorial for demonstrating methods of visualizing multivariate results with `R`.

Accordingly, `R` code is provided throughout the article with commentary, and is provided here in fully reproducible form. The code is divided into the following files:

| Dataset/Topic | R Script | Rendered HTML |
|:-------------:|:--------:|:-------------:|
|      Iris     |   [iris-ex.R](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/iris-ex.R)   |      [iris-ex.html](https://mattsigal.github.io/eqcov_supp/iris-ex.html)     |
|      Wine     |   [wine-ex.R](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/wine-ex.R)   |      [wine-ex.html](https://mattsigal.github.io/eqcov_supp/wine-ex.html)     |
|     Skulls    |   [skulls-ex.R](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/skulls-ex.R)   |      [skulls-ex.html](https://mattsigal.github.io/eqcov_supp/skulls-ex.html)     |
|   betadisper  |   [betadisp-ex.R](https://github.com/mattsigal/eqcov_supp/blob/master/betadisp-ex.R)   |      [betadisp-ex.html](https://mattsigal.github.io/eqcov_supp/betadisp-ex.html)     |
  
Questions and commentary can be directed to either @friendly or @mattsigal.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
